content: Log in with your Google account. You can access the Gmail homepage from the menu bar at the top of the Google search engine. You will need to sign in with your Google account in order to access your Gmail inbox. Browse your emails. Your inbox is automatically sorted into tabs. The default tabs are Primary, Social, and Promotions. You can add Updates and Forums tabs to further sort your email. Primary are your personal emails between people. Social are emails from social networking services such as Facebook and Twitter. Promotions are emails that you receive from marketing that you have signed up for. View email conversations. Any replies to an email are grouped together into a single conversation. The most recent reply will be shown first, and previous emails in the conversation can be expanded with the Expand icon. Archive old messages. You can send older messages to the Archive to store them but keep them from cluttering up your inbox. Archived mail can be found in the All Mail label in the left menu. If someone replies to an archived mail, the conversation will be moved back to your inbox. Delete email you don’t need. Although Google provides a lot of free storage, you may want to delete messages to free up some space. Select the messages that you want to delete and click the Trash Can item. These emails will be permanently deleted after 30 days. Star important emails. You can add a Star to emails that you want to remember for later. This will mark the email with a Star icon, and you can use the left menu to browse only your Starred emails. Use this to mark emails that you need to replay to later, or emails that you don’t want to have to dig for. You can add more icons by clicking the Gear menu and selecting Settings. In the General tab, look for the Stars section. Drag icons to In Use that you want to add. Once they’ve been added, click the Star icon multiple times on an email to scroll through the available icons. Use labels to sort your mail. In the Settings menu, click the Labels tab. Here you can browse through the preexisting labels, which will be listed in the left menu of Gmail. Click the “Create new label” button to create a new label. Click the Filters button to create a rule that will sort incoming mail into the labels you’ve created. Click the “Create a new filter” link to set up a new rule. You can have a filter set by who the email is from, who it is to, words in the subject, and words in the body. Once you have designated your filter, click “Create filter with this search”. Apply a rule to the filter. Once you have set the filter, check the “Apply the label:” box and select the label that you want. If you want it to go straight into the label and not appear in your inbox, check the “Skip Inbox” box. Compose an email. To write an email, click the red Compose button at the top of the left menu. A New Message window will open. Enter the address into the “To” field. If you have the person saved as a contact, you can enter their name and select them from the dropdown menu that appears. “Cc” will send a copy to another recipient. “Bcc” will send a copy to another recipient without any of the other recipients knowing. If you have multiple accounts linked to your Gmail account, you can choose which one you want to send the message from by clicking the arrow next to your address in the “From” field. You can change the formatting of your text by clicking on the “A” button next to the send button. This will open a small menu that allows you to change the font, size, color, as well as create lists and indents. You can attach a file to the email by clicking the paperclip icon. This will open a window that will allow you to browse your computer for a file to attach. There is a 25MB file size limit for attached files. You can send money using Google Wallet by hovering over the + sign and clicking the $ icon. Google will ask you to verify your identity if you have not already. You can insert images and Google Drive documents into your email by hovering over the + sign as well. Open Google Drive. You can access it from the top menu bar above Google sites. Google Drive replaced Google Docs, but shares much of the same functionality. You can create, edit, and share documents, as well as store files from your computer to be accessed anywhere. You will need to log in with your Google account. Google Drive is free with all Google accounts. Create a new document. Click the red Create button to start a new document. A list will open, allowing you to choose from a word processing document, a spreadsheet, a presentation, or a drawing. You can add more functionality by clicking the “Connect more apps” button at the bottom of the list. You can browse other add-ons from Google as well as third-party developers. Edit your new document. Once you’ve chosen your format, you can start editing your document. Click on the title at the top to change it. Use the toolbar to make formatting adjustments. The toolbar options will change depending on the type of file that you are creating. All changes are saved automatically as you work. Download the document. If you want to download your document to your computer, click File and then select “Download as”. You will be given an option of file formats. Pick the one that matches the programs that you use. Share the document. You can share the document with other Google Drive users by clicking File and the selecting “Share…” This will open the Sharing Settings. Here you can add people to the list of collaborators, as well as link to the document using popular services such as Facebook and Twitter. Upload files from your computer. You can upload files that you want to backup from your computer to Google Drive. Click the red Upload button next to the Create button. You can choose to upload individual files or entire folders. Any file type can be uploaded to Google Drive. Certain files, such as Word documents, can be converted into Google documents by clicking the Settings menu in the Upload window. Your uploaded documents will be added to your Google Drive list. You can download the Google Drive program for your computer that will allow you to create a shared folder that syncs with Drive automatically. Click the “Connect Drive to your desktop” button to download it. All free Google Drive accounts come with 15 GB of storage (shared across all of your Google services). If you run out of space, delete unwanted files and emails, or purchase more storage from Google for a monthly fee. Create folders to sort your files. Click the Add Folder button at the top of Google Drive to create a custom folder. You can then drag and drop files into the folder, cleaning up your Drive interface. Go to the Google homepage and type your search. Formatting your search in different ways will affect the results that you receive. Try to keep your search terms simple to get the best results. Search using the important words, and leave out the question. The “I'm Feeling Lucky” button will take you directly to the first search result. Try to use words that the websites that you are looking for will use. For example, if your tooth is hurting, search “toothache” as opposed to “my tooth hurts”. This will result in more informative websites. If you need a precise result for your search, put quotations mark around it. This will make Google only search for the exact word or phrase in the quotes. For example, if you entered chocolate cookies , without quotes, Google would find any pages containing the word “chocolate” or the word “cookies” (but pages with both words do end up higher in the results). If you put “chocolate cookies” in the search it would search only for pages that contain that exact phrase. Exclude a word from a search by using a dash. Put the dash in front of the word that you want to exclude. This will allow you to remove unwanted search result. Enter equations to see the calculated result as the first entry. This will open the calculator tool in Google, which you can use to enter new equations. Enter units to be converted to have Google tell you the conversion. For example, enter 1 cup = ounces and the conversion will be displayed before website search results. You can then use the pull-down menus to change units. Most punctuation is ignored during a Google search. Sort your search results. Once you’ve entered your search, you can narrow down the results by clicking on the tabs at the top of the results list. Web shows websites. This is the default tab. Images shows a list of images that correspond to your search. If your search result matches a lot of images, the most popular ones will be displayed as a search result in the Web tab. Maps shows your search result on a map. Usually when you enter a location into the search, a map will appear in the Web tab. The shopping tab will show products available in your area or online that relate to your search. Blogs will show any blog posts that relate to your search. You can click the More tab to search through other Google services, such as the Play Store, Recipes, and more. Refine your search. You can add specific parameters to your search by opening the Advanced Search tool. You can open this by scrolling to the bottom of the search results and clicking the Advanced Search link. In the “Find pages with…” section, you can specify exactly how you want Google to search for your terms. These can be achieved through the regular search box as well, and the instructions are listed beside each entry. In the “Then narrow your results by…” section, you can add filters that will hide results that aren’t relevant to you. You can set the desired language, region, update date, specific site, and more. For example, you could search for only French YouTube videos uploaded this year. Sign in to your Google account. Click the red Sign In button in the top-right corner to sign in with your Google account. This will help tailor searches to you as well as allow you to save your searching preferences. If you see your name and picture in the top-right corner, you are successfully signed in. Your Google account is the same across all Google products, including Gmail, Drive, Maps, YouTube, and more. Set your search settings. After performing a search, click the Gear icon in the top-right corner of the results page. Select Search Settings from the menu. You can choose to filter explicit results, show instant searches while typing, adjust the number of search results displayed per page, and more. These settings will not be saved when you exit Google unless you are signed in with your Google account. Open Google Maps. Maps can be accessed from the top menu bar on any Google site. By default, Maps should open showing your current location, or a close approximation. Enter a map search. You can search for businesses, landmarks, cities, addresses, map coordinates, and more in the map search. Google will attempt to provide the most relevant results, which will be listed in the left frame. Navigate the map. Use your mouse and keyboard to move around the map. You can zoom in and out of the map by dragging the slider, or by scrolling your mouse wheel up and down. The + and – keys on the keyboard will also some the map. Click and drag the map to move it around, or use the arrow keys to scroll. You can also click the four-directional button in the top corner to scroll around the map. Find out what’s nearby. Right-click on a location of the map and select “What’s Here” from the menu. This will place a pin on the map, and nearby listed businesses and locations will appear in the left frame. Click the “Search nearby” link to search for other locations near the pin that you placed. Get directions. Click on any location in the map to pull up its information. From the Information window, click on the Directions link to open the navigation interface. In the left menu, you can designate your starting point, and choose your method of transportation. When you click “Get directions” turn by turn directions will be displayed, and the route will appear on the main map. Estimated travel time, adjusted for current traffic, will be displayed next to each suggested route. You can adjust your route by clicking and dragging on any part of it. The route will be recalculated to go as close to the new point as possible. Alternatively, you can right-click anywhere on the map and select “Directions to here” to open the navigation interface. Listen to music using Google Play Music . Music allows you to upload music files from your computer as well as browse Google’s extensive digital music library. Create your Google+ profile . Google+ is Google’s social networking service. Use it to create an online presence, follow trends and people, and connect with your friends. Sort out your life with Google Calendar . Use the Calendar to sync all of your important dates across Google’s services. You can share your calendars and events with others, and create multiple calendars for different aspects of your life. Use Google Scholar to research papers for school . Google Scholar will provide search results from peer-reviewed journals and articles. You can use these for research papers and presentations. Join some Google Groups . Google Groups are collections of people that share similar interests. Use the Groups to post and read information relevant to you. Read the latest news with Google News . Google News allows you to create a personalized news feed with the latest stories from every major and minor news source.

<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Use-Google">How to Use Google</a></h1>
<div class="ss_info" id="expert_coauthor">
<a class="author_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		Author Info</a>
</div>
<p class="vertical_toc" id="method_toc">
<span class="header_toc">Explore this Article</span>

<div id="sp_icon_body">
		wikiHow is a “wiki,” similar to Wikipedia, which means that many of our articles are co-written by multiple authors. To create this article, 74 people, some anonymous, worked to edit and improve it over time.  This article has also been viewed 137,529 times.
		<a class="sp_learn_more_link" href="/wikiHow:About-wikiHow#Why_should_you_choose_wikiHow_first.3F_sub">Learn more...</a>
</div>
</div>
<p>Google may be synonymous with searching the Internet, but the services they offer are far broader than simple searching. From email to document creation, calendars to music, Google products can be used for almost every aspect of life online. Follow this guide to not only get the most relevant search results, but also get the most use out of all of the products Google offers.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Sending_and_Receiving_Mail_with_Gmail_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Sending_and_Receiving_Mail_with_Gmail">Sending and Receiving Mail with Gmail</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:636px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-1-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-1-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Use-Google-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-636px-Use-Google-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" height="477" id="img_b6921cd225" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="636"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b6921cd225')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="477" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Use-Google-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-636px-Use-Google-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" width="636"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Log in with your Google account.</b> You can access the Gmail homepage from the menu bar at the top of the Google search engine. You will need to sign in with your Google account in order to access your Gmail inbox.

<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-2-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-2-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Use-Google-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_5022de5515" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5022de5515')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Use-Google-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Browse your emails.</b> Your inbox is automatically sorted into tabs. The default tabs are Primary, Social, and Promotions. You can add Updates and Forums tabs to further sort your email.

<ul>
<li>Primary are your personal emails between people.</li>
<li>Social are emails from social networking services such as Facebook and Twitter.</li>
<li>Promotions are emails that you receive from marketing that you have signed up for.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-3-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-3-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Use-Google-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" height="547" id="img_7c8c8521ab" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7c8c8521ab')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="547" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Use-Google-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">View email conversations.</b> Any replies to an email are grouped together into a single conversation. The most recent reply will be shown first, and previous emails in the conversation can be expanded with the Expand icon.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:552px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-4-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-4-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Use-Google-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-552px-Use-Google-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" height="414" id="img_3ca3769d19" width="552"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3ca3769d19')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="414" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Use-Google-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-552px-Use-Google-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" width="552"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Archive old messages.</b> You can send older messages to the Archive to store them but keep them from cluttering up your inbox. Archived mail can be found in the All Mail label in the left menu.

<ul>
<li>If someone replies to an archived mail, the conversation will be moved back to your inbox.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-5-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-5-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Use-Google-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_62446fa044" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_62446fa044')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Use-Google-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Delete email you don’t need.</b> Although Google provides a lot of free storage, you may want to delete messages to free up some space. Select the messages that you want to delete and click the Trash Can item. These emails will be permanently deleted after 30 days.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:503px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-6-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-6-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Use-Google-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-503px-Use-Google-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" height="377" id="img_ef8176a797" width="503"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ef8176a797')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="377" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Use-Google-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-503px-Use-Google-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" width="503"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Star important emails.</b> You can add a Star to emails that you want to remember for later. This will mark the email with a Star icon, and you can use the left menu to browse only your Starred emails. Use this to mark emails that you need to replay to later, or emails that you don’t want to have to dig for.

<ul>
<li>You can add more icons by clicking the Gear menu and selecting Settings. In the General tab, look for the Stars section. Drag icons to In Use that you want to add. Once they’ve been added, click the Star icon multiple times on an email to scroll through the available icons.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-7-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-7-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Use-Google-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_d73027ac09" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d73027ac09')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Use-Google-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use labels to sort your mail.</b> In the Settings menu, click the Labels tab. Here you can browse through the preexisting labels, which will be listed in the left menu of Gmail. Click the “Create new label” button to create a new label.

<ul>
<li>Click the Filters button to create a rule that will sort incoming mail into the labels you’ve created. Click the “Create a new filter” link to set up a new rule.
<ul>
<li>You can have a filter set by who the email is from, who it is to, words in the subject, and words in the body. Once you have designated your filter, click “Create filter with this search”.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Apply a rule to the filter. Once you have set the filter, check the “Apply the label:” box and select the label that you want. If you want it to go straight into the label and not appear in your inbox, check the “Skip Inbox” box.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:638px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-8-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-8-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Use-Google-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-638px-Use-Google-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" height="479" id="img_7f01f56fcf" width="638"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7f01f56fcf')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="479" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Use-Google-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-638px-Use-Google-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" width="638"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Compose an email.</b> To write an email, click the red Compose button at the top of the left menu. A New Message window will open. Enter the address into the “To” field. If you have the person saved as a contact, you can enter their name and select them from the dropdown menu that appears.

<ul>
<li>“Cc” will send a copy to another recipient. “Bcc” will send a copy to another recipient without any of the other recipients knowing.</li>
<li>If you have multiple accounts linked to your Gmail account, you can choose which one you want to send the message from by clicking the arrow next to your address in the “From” field.</li>
<li>You can change the formatting of your text by clicking on the “A” button next to the send button. This will open a small menu that allows you to change the font, size, color, as well as create lists and indents.</li>
<li>You can attach a file to the email by clicking the paperclip icon. This will open a window that will allow you to browse your computer for a file to attach. There is a 25MB file size limit for attached files.</li>
<li>You can send money using Google Wallet by hovering over the + sign and clicking the $ icon. Google will ask you to verify your identity if you have not already.</li>
<li>You can insert images and Google Drive documents into your email by hovering over the + sign as well.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Creating_and_Sharing_Files_with_Google_Drive_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Creating_and_Sharing_Files_with_Google_Drive">Creating and Sharing Files with Google Drive</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-9-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-9-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Use-Google-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_711b14d1b4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_711b14d1b4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Use-Google-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Open Google Drive.</b> You can access it from the top menu bar above Google sites. Google Drive replaced Google Docs, but shares much of the same functionality. You can create, edit, and share documents, as well as store files from your computer to be accessed anywhere.

<ul>
<li>You will need to log in with your Google account. Google Drive is free with all Google accounts.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Create a new document.</b> Click the red Create button to start a new document. A list will open, allowing you to choose from a word processing document, a spreadsheet, a presentation, or a drawing.
<div class="mwimg tcenter floatcenter" style="max-width:357px">
<a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-10-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-10-Version-3.jpg"><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 10" class="whcdn" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Use-Google-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/v4-357px-Use-Google-Step-10-Version-3.jpg" height="268" id="img_634444feef" style="display:none" width="357"/><script>var img = document.getElementById('img_634444feef');
defer.add(img);
</script></a><noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 10" class="whcdn" height="268" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Use-Google-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/v4-357px-Use-Google-Step-10-Version-3.jpg" width="357"/></noscript>
</div>
<ul>
<li>You can add more functionality by clicking the “Connect more apps” button at the bottom of the list. You can browse other add-ons from Google as well as third-party developers.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:506px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-11-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-11-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Use-Google-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-506px-Use-Google-Step-11-Version-3.jpg" height="380" id="img_03c886d866" width="506"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_03c886d866')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="380" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Use-Google-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-506px-Use-Google-Step-11-Version-3.jpg" width="506"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Edit your new document.</b> Once you’ve chosen your format, you can start editing your document. Click on the title at the top to change it. Use the toolbar to make formatting adjustments.

<ul>
<li>The toolbar options will change depending on the type of file that you are creating.</li>
<li>All changes are saved automatically as you work.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-12-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-12-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Use-Google-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-12-Version-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_9e7991663c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9e7991663c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Use-Google-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-12-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Download the document.</b> If you want to download your document to your computer, click File and then select “Download as”. You will be given an option of file formats. Pick the one that matches the programs that you use.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-13-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-13-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Use-Google-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_cdc6b1de8e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_cdc6b1de8e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Use-Google-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Share the document.</b> You can share the document with other Google Drive users by clicking File and the selecting “Share…” This will open the Sharing Settings. Here you can add people to the list of collaborators, as well as link to the document using popular services such as Facebook and Twitter.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:458px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-14-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-14-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Use-Google-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-458px-Use-Google-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" height="343" id="img_98c7a6f727" width="458"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_98c7a6f727')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="343" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Use-Google-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-458px-Use-Google-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" width="458"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Upload files from your computer.</b> You can upload files that you want to backup from your computer to Google Drive. Click the red Upload button next to the Create button. You can choose to upload individual files or entire folders.

<ul>
<li>Any file type can be uploaded to Google Drive. Certain files, such as Word documents, can be converted into Google documents by clicking the Settings menu in the Upload window. Your uploaded documents will be added to your Google Drive list.</li>
<li>You can download the Google Drive program for your computer that will allow you to create a shared folder that syncs with Drive automatically. Click the “Connect Drive to your desktop” button to download it.</li>
<li>All free Google Drive accounts come with 15 GB of storage (shared across all of your Google services). If you run out of space, delete unwanted files and emails, or purchase more storage from Google for a monthly fee.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:469px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-15-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-15-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Use-Google-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-469px-Use-Google-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" height="352" id="img_b900629ed8" width="469"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b900629ed8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="352" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Use-Google-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-469px-Use-Google-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" width="469"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Create folders to sort your files.</b> Click the Add Folder button at the top of Google Drive to create a custom folder. You can then drag and drop files into the folder, cleaning up your Drive interface.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Searching_the_Web_with_Google_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Searching_the_Web_with_Google">Searching the Web with Google</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Google-home-page-2017.png?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Google-home-page-2017.png"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Google home page 2017.png" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Google-home-page-2017.png/728px-Google-home-page-2017.png" height="345" id="img_227b9d35b5" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_227b9d35b5')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Google home page 2017.png" class="whcdn content-fill" height="345" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Google-home-page-2017.png/728px-Google-home-page-2017.png" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Go to the Google homepage and type your search.</b> Formatting your search in different ways will affect the results that you receive. Try to keep your search terms simple to get the best results. Search using the important words, and leave out the question. The “I'm Feeling Lucky” button will take you directly to the first search result.

<ul>
<li>Try to use words that the websites that you are looking for will use. For example, if your tooth is hurting, search “toothache” as opposed to “my tooth hurts”. This will result in more informative websites.</li>
<li>If you need a precise result for your search, put quotations mark around it. This will make Google only search for the exact word or phrase in the quotes.
<ul>
<li>For example, if you entered <b>chocolate cookies</b>, without quotes, Google would find any pages containing the word “chocolate” <b>or</b> the word “cookies” (but pages with both words do end up higher in the results). If you put <b>“chocolate cookies”</b> in the search it would search only for pages that contain that exact phrase.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Exclude a word from a search by using a dash. Put the dash in front of the word that you want to exclude. This will allow you to remove unwanted search result.</li>
<li>Enter equations to see the calculated result as the first entry. This will open the calculator tool in Google, which you can use to enter new equations.</li>
<li>Enter units to be converted to have Google tell you the conversion. For example, enter <b>1 cup = ounces</b> and the conversion will be displayed before website search results. You can then use the pull-down menus to change units.</li>
<li>Most punctuation is ignored during a Google search.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-17-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-17-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Use-Google-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" height="545" id="img_86ea40ece6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_86ea40ece6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="545" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Use-Google-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Sort your search results.</b> Once you’ve entered your search, you can narrow down the results by clicking on the tabs at the top of the results list.

<ul>
<li>Web shows websites. This is the default tab.</li>
<li>Images shows a list of images that correspond to your search. If your search result matches a lot of images, the most popular ones will be displayed as a search result in the Web tab.</li>
<li>Maps shows your search result on a map. Usually when you enter a location into the search, a map will appear in the Web tab.</li>
<li>The shopping tab will show products available in your area or online that relate to your search.</li>
<li>Blogs will show any blog posts that relate to your search.</li>
<li>You can click the More tab to search through other Google services, such as the Play Store, Recipes, and more.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-18-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-18-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Use-Google-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-18-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_bd710fcb06" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_bd710fcb06')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Use-Google-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-18-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Refine your search.</b> You can add specific parameters to your search by opening the Advanced Search tool. You can open this by scrolling to the bottom of the search results and clicking the Advanced Search link.

<ul>
<li>In the “Find pages with…” section, you can specify exactly how you want Google to search for your terms. These can be achieved through the regular search box as well, and the instructions are listed beside each entry.</li>
<li>In the “Then narrow your results by…” section, you can add filters that will hide results that aren’t relevant to you. You can set the desired language, region, update date, specific site, and more. For example, you could search for only French YouTube videos uploaded this year.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Sign in to your Google account.</b> Click the red Sign In button in the top-right corner to sign in with your Google account. This will help tailor searches to you as well as allow you to save your searching preferences. If you see your name and picture in the top-right corner, you are successfully signed in.
<div class="mwimg tcenter floatcenter" style="max-width:388px">
<a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-19-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-19-Version-2.jpg"><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 19" class="whcdn" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Use-Google-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/v4-388px-Use-Google-Step-19-Version-2.jpg" height="291" id="img_de47761cd4" style="display:none" width="388"/><script>var img = document.getElementById('img_de47761cd4');
defer.add(img);
</script></a><noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 19" class="whcdn" height="291" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Use-Google-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/v4-388px-Use-Google-Step-19-Version-2.jpg" width="388"/></noscript>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Your Google account is the same across all Google products, including Gmail, Drive, Maps, YouTube, and more.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-20.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-20.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Use-Google-Step-20.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-20.jpg" height="546" id="img_1f1cb5d389" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_1f1cb5d389')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Use-Google-Step-20.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-20.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Set your search settings.</b> After performing a search, click the Gear icon in the top-right corner of the results page. Select Search Settings from the menu.

<ul>
<li>You can choose to filter explicit results, show instant searches while typing, adjust the number of search results displayed per page, and more.</li>
<li>These settings will not be saved when you exit Google unless you are signed in with your Google account.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Getting_Around_with_Google_Maps_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Getting_Around_with_Google_Maps">Getting Around with Google Maps</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-21.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-21.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Use-Google-Step-21.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-21.jpg" height="546" id="img_ee1c011c3d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ee1c011c3d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Use-Google-Step-21.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-21.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Open Google Maps.</b> Maps can be accessed from the top menu bar on any Google site. By default, Maps should open showing your current location, or a close approximation.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:559px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-22.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-22.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Use-Google-Step-22.jpg/aid9889-v4-559px-Use-Google-Step-22.jpg" height="420" id="img_b503f0110e" width="559"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b503f0110e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" height="420" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Use-Google-Step-22.jpg/aid9889-v4-559px-Use-Google-Step-22.jpg" width="559"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Enter a map search.</b> You can search for businesses, landmarks, cities, addresses, map coordinates, and more in the map search. Google will attempt to provide the most relevant results, which will be listed in the left frame.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-23.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-23.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Use-Google-Step-23.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-23.jpg" height="547" id="img_01ad2f0af9" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_01ad2f0af9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" height="547" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Use-Google-Step-23.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-23.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Navigate the map.</b> Use your mouse and keyboard to move around the map.

<ul>
<li>You can zoom in and out of the map by dragging the slider, or by scrolling your mouse wheel up and down. The + and – keys on the keyboard will also some the map.</li>
<li>Click and drag the map to move it around, or use the arrow keys to scroll. You can also click the four-directional button in the top corner to scroll around the map.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-24.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-24.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Use-Google-Step-24.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-24.jpg" height="546" id="img_21c10cd5fc" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_21c10cd5fc')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Use-Google-Step-24.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-24.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Find out what’s nearby.</b> Right-click on a location of the map and select “What’s Here” from the menu. This will place a pin on the map, and nearby listed businesses and locations will appear in the left frame.

<ul>
<li>Click the “Search nearby” link to search for other locations near the pin that you placed.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-25.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-25.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Use-Google-Step-25.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-25.jpg" height="546" id="img_5d43c106e5" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5d43c106e5')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Use-Google-Step-25.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-25.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Get directions.</b> Click on any location in the map to pull up its information. From the Information window, click on the Directions link to open the navigation interface. In the left menu, you can designate your starting point, and choose your method of transportation. When you click “Get directions” turn by turn directions will be displayed, and the route will appear on the main map.

<ul>
<li>Estimated travel time, adjusted for current traffic, will be displayed next to each suggested route.</li>
<li>You can adjust your route by clicking and dragging on any part of it. The route will be recalculated to go as close to the new point as possible.</li>
<li>Alternatively, you can right-click anywhere on the map and select “Directions to here” to open the navigation interface.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Getting_the_Most_from_Google_Services_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>5</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Getting_the_Most_from_Google_Services">Getting the Most from Google Services</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_5">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage underwidth floatcenter" style="max-width:403px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-26.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-26.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Use-Google-Step-26.jpg/aid9889-v4-403px-Use-Google-Step-26.jpg" height="303" id="img_3f2c64af38" width="403"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3f2c64af38')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" height="303" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Use-Google-Step-26.jpg/aid9889-v4-403px-Use-Google-Step-26.jpg" width="403"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Get-Google-Play-Music" title="Get Google Play Music">Listen to music using Google Play Music</a>.</b> Music allows you to upload music files from your computer as well as browse Google’s extensive digital music library.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:WikiHow-on-Google.png?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:WikiHow-on-Google.png"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled WikiHow on Google.png" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/WikiHow-on-Google.png/728px-WikiHow-on-Google.png" height="345" id="img_8201647c46" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_8201647c46')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled WikiHow on Google.png" class="whcdn content-fill" height="345" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/WikiHow-on-Google.png/728px-WikiHow-on-Google.png" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><strong class="selflink">Create your Google+ profile</strong>.</b> Google+ is Google’s social networking service. Use it to create an online presence, follow trends and people, and connect with your friends.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-28.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-28.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 28" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Use-Google-Step-28.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-28.jpg" height="546" id="img_3d89edbbd4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3d89edbbd4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 28" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Use-Google-Step-28.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-28.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Share-Your-Google-Calendar" title="Share Your Google Calendar">Sort out your life with Google Calendar</a>.</b> Use the Calendar to sync all of your important dates across Google’s services. You can share your calendars and events with others, and create multiple calendars for different aspects of your life.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-29.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-29.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 29" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Use-Google-Step-29.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-29.jpg" height="545" id="img_472a21a17e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_472a21a17e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 29" class="whcdn content-fill" height="545" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Use-Google-Step-29.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-29.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Use-Google-Scholar" title="Use Google Scholar">Use Google Scholar to research papers for school</a>.</b> Google Scholar will provide search results from peer-reviewed journals and articles. You can use these for research papers and presentations.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-30.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-30.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 30" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Use-Google-Step-30.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-30.jpg" height="547" id="img_c3ae3ba369" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c3ae3ba369')</script>
</div>

<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Join-Google-Groups" title="Join Google Groups">Join some Google Groups</a>.</b> Google Groups are collections of people that share similar interests. Use the Groups to post and read information relevant to you.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Use-Google-Step-31.jpg?ajax=true&aid=9889" href="#/Image:Use-Google-Step-31.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 31" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Use-Google-Step-31.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-31.jpg" height="547" id="img_54724a5d73" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_54724a5d73')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Use Google Step 31" class="whcdn content-fill" height="547" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Use-Google-Step-31.jpg/aid9889-v4-728px-Use-Google-Step-31.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Personalize-Google-News" title="Personalize Google News">Read the latest news with Google News</a>.</b> Google News allows you to create a personalized news feed with the latest stories from every major and minor news source.

<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions qa_no_answered" data-aid="9889" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>
<a id="qa_add_curated_question">Add New Question</a>
<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs" id="qa_article_questions"></ul>
</div>
<div class="qa_divider qa_no_unpatrolled_questions"></div>
<div class="qa_divider qa_no_visible_answers"></div>
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_ask_heading">Ask a Question</div>
<div id="qa_submitted_question_form">
<input id="qa_asked_question" maxlength="200" placeholder="What do you need to know? We'll do our best to find the answer." type="text"/><div id="qa_asked_count">200 characters left</div>
<input id="qa_email" placeholder="Email address (optional)" type="text"/><div id="qa_email_prompt">Include your email address to get a message when this question is answered.</div>
<a class="button primary" id="qa_submit_button">Submit</a>
</div>
<!--  Template for rendering a submitted question -->
<script id="qa_submitted_question_item" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<li class="qa_sq" data-sqid="{{id}}">
	<div class="qa_divider"></div>
	<div class="qa_li_container">
		<div class="qa_bullet"></div>
		<div class="qa_sq_question">
			<div class="qa_q_txt">{{{text}}}</div>
			<div class="qa_editor_tools">
				<a class="qa_edit_submitted {{#qa_desktop}}button secondary{{/qa_desktop}}">{{qa_curate}}</a>
				{{^mobile_anon_user}}
				<a class="qa_flag_submitted" data-type="sq_flag">{{qa_flag}}</a>
				<a class="qa_ignore_submitted" data-type="sq_ignore">{{qa_ignore}}</a>
				{{/mobile_anon_user}}
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</li>

			</script><!--  Template for answer confirmation  --><script id="qa_answer_confirmation" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_answer_confirmation">

	<span class="x_button"></span>

	<div class="qa_answer_confirmation_response">
		<span class="qa_checkmark"></span>
		<div class="qa_social_login_heading standalone">{{qa_proposed_answer_confirmation}}</div>
	</div>

</div>


			</script><!--  Template form for creating/updating a curated question  --><script id="qa_question_edit_form" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_aq_edit_form">
	<div class="qa_aq_edit_form_status"></div>
	<textarea class="qa_cq_text" spellcheck="true" placeholder="{{qa_edit_form_question_placeholder}}">{{qa_edit_form_question}}</textarea>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_cq_text_error qap_char_limit">{{qa_cq_text_error}}</div>
	<textarea class="qa_ca_text" spellcheck="true" placeholder="{{qa_edit_form_answer_placeholder}}">{{qa_edit_form_answer}}</textarea>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_text_error}}</div>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error2 qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_text_min}}</div>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error3 qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_error_url}}</div>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error_phone qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_error_phone}}</div>
	<input class="qa_pa_email" placeholder="{{qa_pa_email_placeholder}}"/>

	{{#qa_admin}}
		<span class="qa_edit_form_verifier_container">
			{{qa_edit_form_verifier_label}}
			<select class="qa_edit_form_verifier">
				{{#qa_edit_form_verifiers}}
					<option value="{{id}}" {{selected}}>{{name}}</option>
				{{/qa_edit_form_verifiers}}
			</select>
		</span>
		{{#qa_edit_form_show_remove_submitter}}
		<span class="qa_edit_form_remove_submitter_container">
			<label for="qa_aq_remove_submitter">{{qa_edit_form_remove_submitter}}</label> <input type="checkbox" id="qa_aq_remove_submitter" class="qa_checkbox" />
		</span>
		{{/qa_edit_form_show_remove_submitter}}
	{{/qa_admin}}

	<span class="qa_edit_form_inactive_container">
		<label for="qa_aq_inactive">{{qa_edit_form_inactive}}</label> <input type="checkbox" id="qa_aq_inactive" class="qa_checkbox" {{qa_edit_form_inactive_val}}>
	</span>

	<div class="clearall"></div>

	{{#qa_admin}}<a class="qa_aq_delete button primary">{{qa_edit_form_delete}}</a>{{/qa_admin}}
	<a class="qa_aq_submit button primary">{{qa_edit_form_submit}}</a>
	<span class="qa_spinner"></span>
	<a class="qa_aq_cancel button secondary">{{qa_edit_form_cancel}}</a>
</div>

			</script><!--  Template for the social login/signup form  --><script id="qa_social_login_form" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_social_login_form">

	<span class="x_button"></span>

	<div>
		<span class="qa_checkmark"></span>
		<div class="qa_social_login_heading">{{qa_thanks_for_answer}}</div>
	</div>

	<div style="clear: both;"></div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_body">{{qa_social_login_form_cta}}</div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_button_container">
		<div class="qa_button social_login_button facebook_button">
			<span class="social_login_button_icon"></span>
			<span class="social_login_button_text">Facebook</span>
		</div>
		<div class="qa_button social_login_button google_button">
			<span class="social_login_button_icon"></span>
			<span class="social_login_button_text">Google</span>
		</div>
	</div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_sub">{{qa_social_login_disclaimer}}</div>

</div>

			</script><!--  Template for social login/signup confirmation  --><script id="qa_social_login_confirmation" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_social_login_confirmation">

	<span class="x_button"></span>

	<div>
		<img src="{{avatarUrl}}" class="qa_social_login_avatar" alt="user avatar">
		<div class="qa_social_login_heading">{{qa_thanks_for_social_login}}</div>
	</div>

	<div style="clear: both;"></div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_body">{{qa_info_after_social_login}}</div>

	<a class="qa_social_login_done button primary">Done</a>

</div>


			</script><div data-type="" id="qa_flag_options">
<div class="hint_box">
<ul>
<li><a data-option="answered" href="#">Already answered</a></li>
<li><a data-option="not_question" href="#">Not a question</a></li>
<li><a data-option="bad_question" href="#">Bad question</a></li>
<li><a data-option="other" href="#">Other</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div data-type="" id="qa_answer_flag_options">
<div class="hint_box">
<ul></ul>
</div>
</div>
<!--  Template for rendering a desktop ArticleQuestion -->
<script id="qa_article_question_item" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
			<li class="qa_aq qa_block {{#inactive}}qa_inactive{{/inactive}}" data-aqid="{{id}}" data-cqid="{{curatedQuestion.id}}" data-caid="{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.id}}" data-sqid="{{curatedQuestion.submittedId}}" data-qa_inactive="{{inactive}}" data-votes_up="{{votesUp}}" data-votes_down="{{votesDown}}" data-verifier_id="{{verifierId}}" data-submitter_id="{{submitterUserId}}">
	<div class="qa_divider"></div>

	<div class="qa_li_container">
		<div class="qa_question_tab">{{qa_question_label}}</div>
		<div class="qa_q_txt{{#qa_desktop}} question{{/qa_desktop}}">{{{curatedQuestion.text}}}</div>
		{{#qa_staff}}<div class="qa_staff_info">{{staffInfo}}</div>{{/qa_staff}}

		{{#show_editor_tools}}
		<div class="qa_editor_tools">
			<a class="qa_edit_aq">{{qa_edit}}</a>
		</div>
		{{/show_editor_tools}}

		<div class="qa_answers">
			<div class="{{qa_answerer_class}}">
			{{#qa_desktop}}
				<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">{{#verifierId}}{{> qa_expert_hover}}{{/verifierId}}</div>
			{{/qa_desktop}}

				<div class="qa_badge"></div>

			{{#verifierId}}
				<a href="{{#formatName}}{{verifierData.name}}{{/formatName}}" class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" target="_blank" {{#verifierData.imagePath}}style="background-image: url({{verifierData.imagePath}})"{{/verifierData.imagePath}}>
					{{^verifierData.imagePath}}<span>{{verifierData.initials}}</span>{{/verifierData.imagePath}}</a>
			{{/verifierId}}

			{{^verifierId}}
				<div class="qa_person_circle" {{#submitterAvatar}}style="background-image:url({{{submitterAvatar}}})"{{/submitterAvatar}}></div>
			{{/verifierId}}

				<div class="qa_answerer_info">
				{{#verifierId}}
					<div class="qa_user_name">
						<a href="{{#formatName}}{{verifierData.name}}{{/formatName}}" target="_blank">{{verifierData.name}}</a>
					</div>
					<div class="qa_user_title">{{{verifierData.blurb}}}</div>
				{{/verifierId}}

				{{^verifierId}}
					<div class="qa_user_name">{{{submitterDisplayName}}}</div>
				{{/verifierId}}

					<div class="qa_user_label">{{qa_answerer_label}}</div>
					{{#isTopAnswerer}}{{^qa_desktop}}<div class="qa_ta_mobile_extra"></div>{{/qa_desktop}}{{/isTopAnswerer}}
				</div>
			</div>

		{{#qa_desktop}}
			<div class="qa_answer answer">{{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.text}}}</div>
			<div class="qa_answer_footer">
				{{> thumbs_qa_widget}}
				{{^qa_anon}}
				<a class="qa_ignore_answered" href="#">{{qa_flag_duplicate}}</a>
				<p class="qa_ignore_answered_thanks">Thanks!</p>
				{{/qa_anon}}
			</div>
		{{/qa_desktop}}
		{{^qa_desktop}}
		<ul>
			<li class="qa_answer">{{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.text}}}</li>
		</ul>
		{{> thumbs_up_down}}
		{{/qa_desktop}}
		</div>
	</div>
</li>

		</script><!-- Template for rendering an unpatrolled QA --><!--  Template form for desktop thumbs up/down functionality  --><script id="qa_thumbs_qa_widget" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
	<span class='wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg'>{{thumbs_response}}</span>
	<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary">{{qa_thumbs_yes}}</a>
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary">{{qa_thumbs_no}}</a>
	</div>
	<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box">{{qa_thumbs_nohelp}} <span>{{votesDown}}</span></a>
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box">{{qa_thumbs_help}} <span>{{votesUp}}</span></a>
	</div>
</div>



			</script><!--  Template for rendering a Top Answerers data --><script id="top_answerers_qa_widget" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_person_circle" {{#ta_image}}style="background-image:url({{{ta_image}}})"{{/ta_image}}></div>
<div class='qa_ta_name'>
	<span><a href="{{userLink}}" class="sp_namelink" target="_blank">{{userName}}</a>, {{ta_label}}</span><br />
	{{answersCount}} {{ta_answers_label}}
</div>
<div class="qa_ta_cats">
{{#topCats.0}}
	{{ta_subcats_intro}}
	{{#topCats}}<a href="{{cat_link}}">{{cat}}</a>, {{/topCats}}
	{{ta_subcats_outro}}
{{/topCats.0}}
</div>
			</script>
</div>
</div>
<div id="qa_box"></div>
<div class="section googletipsandtricks sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Google_Tips_and_Tricks">Google Tips and Tricks</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="googletipsandtricks">
<div id="sd_container">
<div class="sd_thumb"><a href="/Sample/Google-Tips-and-Tricks"><img class="whcdn" data-src="/images/thumb/7/7c/Google-Tips-and-Tricks.png/340px-Google-Tips-and-Tricks.png" height="440" id="5cc398119b42c" src="https://www.wikihow.com" width="340"/><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5cc398119b42c')
//]]>
</script><noscript>
<p><img class="whcdn" height="440" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Google-Tips-and-Tricks.png/340px-Google-Tips-and-Tricks.png" width="340"/></p>
</noscript>
<span>Google Tips and Tricks</span></a></div>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>With Google, you can also search for images and audio/video results using the same box. Instead of using the Google search, click on the appropriate tab for the type of media you want.</li>
<li>If you have McAfee Site Advisor installed on your computer, there will either be a green check mark, a yellow "!", or a red X next to the search result. Make sure you click on a search result that has a green check mark on it.</li>
<li>Try to use the simplest form of the word possible. For example, instead of <i>ships</i>, use <i>ship</i>. Instead of <i>John's bar</i>, use <i>John bar</i>.</li>
<li>
<a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com/scholar" rel="nofollow">Google Scholar</a> gives more accurate, research-based information.</li>
<li>For faster Google searching, install the Google search toolbar, which is available for Internet Explorer and Firefox. It is found <a class="external text" href="http://toolbar.google.com/firefox/index.html" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>Clicking on <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com/advanced_search?hl=en" rel="nofollow">Advanced Search</a> will sometimes return better results.</li>
</ul>

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To use Google to search the internet, navigate to the Google homepage where the search bar is located. Next, type in simple search terms and avoid using punctuation to get the best results. If you need very precise results, put quotations marks around your search terms and Google will only search for those exact words or phrases. Once you’ve entered your search, you can narrow down the results by clicking on tabs like "Web," "Image," and "Video" at the top of the results list. <span id="summary_last_sentence">For tips on using other Google tools, such as email, maps, and Google Docs, read on!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>

    "author": {
